intro: Pilosella salebrata, commonly known as the slender leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Pilosella salebrata is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread readily through seeds.
